column1: Narrator : There’s no beach on this island. After the water rises a small and charming wood.
Narrator : The birds are singing, the branches dance quietly to a soft and bright sun.
column2: Narrator : In the dark woods reigns a deadly silence. Only a few moving branches can be heard, along with regular owls noises.

column1: Narrator : A bit further, a huge stone door lays deep in an immense rock. It’s surrounded bu scriptures and engravings.

column3: PlayerSpeak : Its locked ! And is WON’T budge.
column4: Narrator : The stone door opens wide and calmly. It reveals a staircase, going down. You can’t see the bottom.

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE hears a soft « click » behing the stone door.
column3: Narrator : On the engravings, seven angels are sounding the apocalypse. Strangely, their hands are empty.
column5: Narrator : Acces is granted to childish souls, and their soft companion
column7: PlayerSpeak : It looks like stars, and the moon
column9: Narrator : « After rolling on my six faces, I’m only the fruit of hazard »
column11: Narrator : The engravings read : « When I’m full of needles, I relieve you of someone you hate »
column13: Narrator : After having eaten a ton of oysters, and if you’re really lucky, you may stumble upon me.
column15: Narrator : As CAPITAINE approaches the engravings, the rock sinks in the earth, only to leave a large hole.
column19: Narrator : The engravings read : « My flame is not eternal »

column15: Narrator : After an enternity, CAPITAINE is at the bottom of the hole.

column1: Narrator : Everything is dark. But, further, a treasure shines a bright light around the cave.

column2: PlayerSpeak : I’ve taking all the gold

column1: PlayerSpeak : Wow, that’s a lot of money
